protocol_name: Determination of protein levels of browning genes in murine adipose tissues by western blotting.
protocol_name_html: Determination of protein levels of browning genes in murine adipose tissues by western blotting.
description: Increasing energy expenditure by stimulating thermogenesis through activation of brown adipose tissue (BAT) and/or induction of browning of white adipose tissue (WAT) is considered a promising strategy to treat/prevent obesity and related metabolic diseases. Whereas WAT is adapted to store energy as triglycerides, BAT produces heat (non-shivering thermogenesis). In brown adipocytes, the uncoupling protein-1 (Ucp-1) regulates conversion of energy into heat by uncoupling ATP production from mitochondrial respiration. Also in WAT adaptive Ucp-1 positive adipocytes (brown in white: brite or beige) can arise, predominantly in subcutaneous (s) WAT. Therefore, this browning of sWAT can be visualized by making sWAT protein extracts and by analyzing protein levels of brown adipocyte-specific markers such as Ucp-1 and peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor gamma coactivator 1 α (Pgc1α) in these extracts.
before_start:
A) Prepare Protein lysis buffer RL (10 ml):
-1 ml 100 mM Na2PO4 (10 mM) /1.5 M sodium chloride NaCl (0.15 M)
-400µl 25% Triton-X-100 (1%)
-100µl 10% sodium dodecyl sulfate (0.1%)
-1 ml 5% sodium deoxycholate (0.5%)
-1 ml 2% sodium azide (0.2%)
-6.5 ml MilliQ water

 

*Add fresh 1/100 EDTA and phosphatase and protease inhibitor cocktail (Halt phosphatase and protease inhibitor cocktail (100x), Thermo Fisher Scientific catalog number 78442) to buffer.

B) Prepare NUPAGE LDS sample buffer supplemented with β-mercaptoethanol (20:1)
warning: -β-mercaptoethanol needs to be handled in a fume hood.
manuscript_citation: Bauters D, Bedossa P, Lijnen HR, Hemmeryckx B (2018) Functional role of ADAMTS5 in adiposity and metabolic health. PLoS ONE 13(1): e0190595. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0190595

components.data:
Add protein lysis buffer RL to tissues (volume of buffer (µl) = tissue weight in mg x 4) in 1.5 ml tube with glass beads.

 

*Protein lysis buffer RL (10 ml):

-1 ml 100 mM Na2PO4 (10 mM) /1.5 M sodium chloride NaCl (0.15 M)

-400µl 25% Triton-X-100 (1%)

-100µl 10% sodium dodecyl sulfate (0.1%)

-1 ml 5% sodium deoxycholate (0.5%)

-1 ml 2% sodium azide (0.2%)

-6.5 ml MilliQ water

 

*Add fresh 1/100 EDTA and phosphatase and protease inhibitor cocktail to buffer.
components.name: Description

*Protein lysis buffer RL (10 ml):

source_data.reagent_name: HALT phosphatase and protease inhibitor cocktail (100x)

components.data: Homogenize tissues using a Fastprep Ribolyser (MP Biomedicals, Elsene, Belgium): speed 6 time 40 sec x2, keep on ice in between.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Homogenize tissues using a Fastprep Ribolyser (MP Biomedicals, Elsene, Belgium): speed 6 time 40 sec x2, keep on ice in between.

components.data: Centrifuge at +4°C, 20 min 13000 rpm.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at +4°C, 20 min 13000 rpm.

components.data: Collect supernatans and transfer to new labeled eppendorf tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Collect supernatans and transfer to new labeled eppendorf tube.

components.data:
Measure protein concentration using the Pierce BCA protein assay:

-Make standard curve with bovine serum albumin (2 mg/ml): 1 mg/ml, 500 µg/ml, 250 µg/ml, 125 µg/ml, 62.5 µg/ml, 31.25 µg/ml, 15.625 µg/ml, 7.8125 µg/ml. Dilutions are made with MilliQ water.

-Make dilutions of protein extracts: 1/50 and 1/100 in MilliQ water.

-Apply 50 µl of each standard and sample (in duplicate) to a 96-well plate.

-Mix reagent A (50 parts) with reagent B (1 part) of BCA protein assay and apply 200µl/well

-Incubate plate for 30 min at room temperature in the dark

-Measure absorbance at 550 nm on the microplate reader (ELx808IU, Biotek) using the Gen5 software (Biotek).

-Average protein concentrations/sample.
components.name: Description

-Make standard curve with bovine serum albumin (2 mg/ml): 1 mg/ml, 500 µg/ml, 250 µg/ml, 125 µg/ml, 62.5 µg/ml, 31.25 µg/ml, 15.625 µg/ml, 7.8125 µg/ml. Dilutions are made with MilliQ water.

-Make dilutions of protein extracts: 1/50 and 1/100 in MilliQ water.

-Apply 50 µl of each standard and sample (in duplicate) to a 96-well plate.

-Mix reagent A (50 parts) with reagent B (1 part) of BCA protein assay and apply 200µl/well

-Incubate plate for 30 min at room temperature in the dark

-Measure absorbance at 550 nm on the microplate reader (ELx808IU, Biotek) using the Gen5 software (Biotek).

-Average protein concentrations/sample.

components.data: Prepare protein samples for loading: combine 50 µg of protein with xµl MilliQ water (12 and 25µl in total for a 12- and 10-well gel) and xµl NUPAGE LDS sample buffer (4x) containing β-mercaptoethanol (20:1).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare protein samples for loading: combine 50 µg of protein with xµl MilliQ water (12 and 25µl in total for a 12- and 10-well gel) and xµl NUPAGE LDS sample buffer (4x) containing β-mercaptoethanol (20:1).

components.data: Unpack the NUPAGE 10% Bis-Tris gel and remove the white plastic strip at the bottom and comb.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Unpack the NUPAGE 10% Bis-Tris gel and remove the white plastic strip at the bottom and comb.

components.data: Mount the gel cassette in the running tank (X-Cell Sure Lock, Life Technologies).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mount the gel cassette in the running tank (X-Cell Sure Lock, Life Technologies).

components.data: Fill the tank with 1x NUPAGE MOPS SDS running buffer (20x), supplemented with 500 µl NUPAGE antioxidant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Fill the tank with 1x NUPAGE MOPS SDS running buffer (20x), supplemented with 500 µl NUPAGE antioxidant.

components.data: Heat protein samples for 5 min in heat block at 95°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Heat protein samples for 5 min in heat block at 95°C.

components.data: Load the samples and 8µl of Pageruler prestained protein ladder (10 – 180 kDa). Ladder contains two reference bands orange = 70 kDa and green = 10 kDa.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Load the samples and 8µl of Pageruler prestained protein ladder (10 – 180 kDa). Ladder contains two reference bands orange = 70 kDa and green = 10 kDa.

components.data: Close the tank carefully and connect to power supply Powerease 500 (Thermo Fisher Scientific).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Close the tank carefully and connect to power supply Powerease 500 (Thermo Fisher Scientific).

components.data: Start electrophoresis: 55min at 135V.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Start electrophoresis: 55min at 135V.

components.data: Assemble the iBlot transfer stacks on the iBlot gel transfer device (IB1001, Thermo Fisher Scientific): iBlot NC anode stock bottom-mini (04-BLT-BM-UN002, Thermo Fisher Scientific), gel, presoaked in deionized water iBlot filter paper, iBlot cathode stock Top-mini containing nitrocellulose membrane (06-BLT-BM-UN001).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Assemble the iBlot transfer stacks on the iBlot gel transfer device (IB1001, Thermo Fisher Scientific): iBlot NC anode stock bottom-mini (04-BLT-BM-UN002, Thermo Fisher Scientific), gel, presoaked in deionized water iBlot filter paper, iBlot cathode stock Top-mini containing nitrocellulose membrane (06-BLT-BM-UN001).

source_data.reagent_name: iBlot Gel Transfer Stacks, Nitrocellulose, Regular

components.data: Use the Blotting roller to eliminate air bubbles.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use the Blotting roller to eliminate air bubbles.

components.data: Place the Disposable Sponge with the metal contact on the upper right corner of the lid.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the Disposable Sponge with the metal contact on the upper right corner of the lid.

components.data: Close the lid and secure the latch. The red light is on indicating a closed circuit.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Close the lid and secure the latch. The red light is on indicating a closed circuit.

components.data: Select program P1 (25V, 6 min) and press Start/Stop button. The red light changes to green.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Select program P1 (25V, 6 min) and press Start/Stop button. The red light changes to green.

components.data: After transfer, disassemble the stack and remove the membrane.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After transfer, disassemble the stack and remove the membrane.

components.data:
Block the membrane for 2-3hrs in TBST supplemented with 5% milk (Blotting Grade Blocker) on shaker at room temperature.

 

*10x TBS (1L):

-24g Tris Base

-88g NaCl

-Adjust pH to 7.6

-Add deionized water to 1L

 

*TBST (1L):

-100 ml 10x TBS

-0.5 ml Tween

-20 (0.05%)

-Add deionized water to 1L
components.name: Description

components.data:
Add primary antibody and cover:

a. rabbit anti-mouse polyclonal antibody directed to uncoupling protein-1: 1/2000 in TBST supplemented with 5% BSA

b. rabbit anti-mouse polyclonal antibody directed to peroxisome proliferator activated receptor gamma cofactor 1α: 1/4000 in TBST supplemented with 5% milk
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add primary antibody and cover:

a. rabbit anti-mouse polyclonal antibody directed to uncoupling protein-1: 1/2000 in TBST supplemented with 5% BSA

b. rabbit anti-mouse polyclonal antibody directed to peroxisome proliferator activated receptor gamma cofactor 1α: 1/4000 in TBST supplemented with 5% milk

components.data: Incubate overnight at +4°C on shaker.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate overnight at +4°C on shaker.

components.data: Wash membrane 3 x 5 min in TBST.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash membrane 3 x 5 min in TBST.

components.data: Apply secondary horse radish peroxidase (HRP)-labeled Goat anti-Rabbit antibody (1/2000) in TBST supplemented with 5% milk.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Apply secondary horse radish peroxidase (HRP)-labeled Goat anti-Rabbit antibody (1/2000) in TBST supplemented with 5% milk.

source_data.reagent_name: Horse radish peroxidase-labeled Goat anti-rabbit IgGs

components.data: Incubate 1h at room temperature on shaker.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate 1h at room temperature on shaker.

components.data: Wash 3 x 5 min in TBST.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash 3 x 5 min in TBST.

components.data:
Detect UCP-1 and PGC-1α with SuperSignal™ West Femto Maximum Sensitivity Substrate.

-Mix equal volumes of reagent 1 and 2 (1 ml in total), cover tube with tinfoil.

-Place the membrane in transparent foil.

-Incubate with substrate mixture.

-Expose to chemiluminescence (lumi-imager, Chemidoc XRS+ Image Lab™ Software, 1708265 ,Bio-Rad).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

-Place the membrane in transparent foil.

-Expose to chemiluminescence (lumi-imager, Chemidoc XRS+ Image Lab™ Software, 1708265 ,Bio-Rad).

source_data.reagent_name: SuperSignal™ West Femto Maximum Sensitivity Substrate

components.data:
Strip membrane for re-blotting (Re-Blot Plus Mild antibody stripping solution).

-Wash away substrate for 15 min in TBST.

-Incubate the membrane in 5 ml stripping buffer (1X in MilliQ water) for 15 min at room temperature.

-Wash shortly in TBST.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Strip membrane for re-blotting (Re-Blot Plus Mild antibody stripping solution).

-Wash away substrate for 15 min in TBST.

-Incubate the membrane in 5 ml stripping buffer (1X in MilliQ water) for 15 min at room temperature.

-Wash shortly in TBST.

source_data.reagent_name: Re-Blot Plus Mild antibody stripping solution

components.data:
Re-block the membrane and continue as described above for the housekeeping proteins glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate dehydrogenase (GAPDH) and β-actin:

a) primary rabbit monoclonal anti-mouse β-actin 13E5 antibody (1/1000):

-Incubation primary antibody: 1.5hrs at room temperature in TBST/5% milk

 

b) primary rabbit monoclonal anti-mouse GAPDH antibody (1/2000):

-Incubation primary antibody: overnight at +4°C in TBST/5% milk
components.name: Description
